reviews.text: Itâ€™s a very huge shopping  mall, with a variety of shops.The  style is very special  with some typical mong kok feeling areas with stalls, Malaysia food stalls , and there is a very big value market.

Jurong Point, As Singapore's largest shopping mall by tenant count, Jurong Point dominates the western region. Its prime location next to Boon Lay MRT station and Bus Interchange ensures easy accessibility for shoppers from all corners of the island.

It is a hidden gem for foodies! With a diverse range of eateries, there's something to satisfy every craving.

From the delectable dim sum at Tim Ho Wan to the mouthwatering Hainanese chicken rice at Wee Nam Kee, the food options are endless. I particularly love the bustling food court, where I can indulge in affordable local delights like char kway teow and laksa.

The mall's convenient location and ample seating make it the perfect spot for a satisfying meal with friends and family.
Jurong point should use solar panel and natural light lamp. Whole mall is quite hot and we still using handheld fan indoor. Too hot already
Really huge mall with different segments too it with a huge basement maze and up top as well with connecting points tons of options as well which is pretty nice!

Great mall, but this anti-cycling barrier is ridiculous.

Might be better off using push gates still require cyclists to disembark, but at least other pedestrians can easier pass through.
